Article Title: Battlelines drawn: Opposition adds UP advisory to 'must debate' list
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The UP govt advisory that owners of eateries along kanwar yatra route should display their names became one of the focal points of an all-party meeting here Sunday on the eve of the first full-fledged Parliament session after the formation of Modi 3.0 govt .Apart from criticising the order and demanding that discussion on it must take place in Parliament, opposition parties brought up the NEET paper leak issue, which had been prominently raised in the brief session that was held after the Lok Sabha polls.Congress demanded that discussion should also take place on railway safety, Agniveer scheme, Centre-state relations and the security situation in Manipur and J&K.Parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju told reporters that the Centre is ready to debate any issue with an open heart. Deputy leader of Lok Sabha Rajnath Singh urged all MPs not to interrupt when a fellow member is speaking in Parliament.
Article Summary: UP govt advisory that owners of eateries along kanwar yatra route should display their names became one of the focal points of an all-party meeting. Opposition parties brought up the NEET paper leak issue, which had been prominently raised in the brief session that was held after the Lok Sabha polls.

Article Title: Borrowed Aadhaar, phone switched off: How police tracked down IAS officer Puja Khedkar's mother ‘Indubai Dhakane’
Article Text:
Mother of IAS officer arrested after brandishing gun at farmers, faces attempted murder charge

She was found staying under a fake identity in a homestay

(Inputs by Asseem Shaikh)

PUNE: Manorama Khedkar , mother of probationary IAS Puja Khedkar , was arrested on Thursday from a homestay in Raigad district.“She had hired a private cab to visit different places before moving into the home stay facility around 11 pm on Wednesday. She was staying there under a fictitious identity ‘Indubai Dhakane’. The cab driver, Dadasaheb Dhakane, showed his genuine Aadhaar card to the facility owner while Manorama showed the Aadhaar card of the cab driver’s mother to get the room booked,” said Pune Rural SP Pankaj Deshmukh.“Our team, which was tracking her movements, was alerted by a cellphone number which got activated while it was put on surveillance.The location of this cell phone was Hirkaniwadi and our team immediately reached there,” the SP said.Paud police in rural Pune on July 12 had registered the case after a video recently went viral on social media showing Manorama, accompanied by bouncers, brandishing a .25 Webley & Scott pistol on June 5, 2023, during an argument with some farmers over a land ownership issue at Dhadhawali village in Mulshi taluka. One of the farmers lodged a complaint.Manorama was produced before judicial magistrate first class Sudhir G Barde in Paud on Thursday afternoon and was remanded in police custody till July 20 after assistant public prosecutor Amar Nanaware told the court that the police have invoked an attempted murder charge against Manorama on the basis of a supplementary statement recorded by complainant Pandharinath Pasalkar.Pasalkar alleged in the complaint that Manorama reached the parcel of land in a four-wheeler and picked up an argument with him.“She abused and threatened me and other villagers when I told her to leave the place as the land dispute would be decided by the civil court where the matter is pending. However, she insisted that she had purchased the land and her name was in the 7/12 extract showing ownership,” the complainant stated.In the supplementary statement, Pasalkar alleged that Manorama put a pistol to his head and was about to pull the trigger when he sat down in a panic reaction and people accompanying her pulled her back.Nanaware submitted that Pasalkar had then filed a complaint application against Manorama and others with the Paud police but did not pursue the matter out of fear. Pasalkar approached the police after the video relating to the incident went viral on social media recently.Nanaware also submitted in court that the police needed Manorama’s custodial remand to recover her licensed pistol and establish the places she visited while on the run.Nanware also said that the police needed to arrest the other accused named in the FIR and seek details of the land dispute that led to the incident.Manohar Aukirkar, the owner of ‘Parvati Nivas,’ said, “Around 11pm on Wednesday, aman, who drove to our establishment in a car, approached me and said that he and his mother needed a room for an overnight stay. It was raining heavily then and since a woman was accompanying him, we took a humanitarian approach and gave them a room on the second floor of the facility.”Aukirkar said, “We checked the man’s Aadhaar card which carried the name Dadasaheb Dhakane and his photo. The man told us that his mother’s name was Indubai Dhakane. After recording their details, we gave him the room keys.”The video of Manorama brandishing the firearm surfaced after her daughter, probationary IAS officer Puja Khedkar, was shunted to Washim from Pune for demanding facilities she was not entitled to get.Soon one thing after the other started tumbling out about the family, and questions were also raised about Puja’s OBC and disability certificates, which she had used to get IAS cadre despite asub-800 UPSC score.
Article Summary: Manorama Khedkar, mother of probationary IAS Puja Khed Kar, was arrested on Thursday from a homestay in Raigad district. A video recently went viral on social media showing Manorama brandishing a.25 Webley & Scott pistol on June 5, 2023, during an argument with some farmers over a land ownership issue.

Article Title: 'If helpless people come knocking ... ': Mamata's offer amid Bangladesh unrest
Article Text: NEW DELHI: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Sunday offered to provide shelter to those in distress amid the ongoing violence in Bangladesh. She cited the United Nations Resolution on refugees as justification for her stance, considering the severe law and order breakdown that has gripped Bangladesh in recent days."I should not be speaking on the affairs of Bangladesh since that is a sovereign nation and whatever needs to be said on the issue is a subject matter of the Centre.But I can tell you this, if helpless people come knocking on the doors of Bengal, we will surely provide them shelter," Banerjee said.Banerjee, speaking at the 'Martyrs Day' rally of the Trinamool Congress in Kolkata, drew a parallel to the situation during the Bodo strife in Assam, when Assamese people were allowed to reside in the Alipurduars area of North Bengal.The chief minister also pledged assistance to West Bengal residents whose relatives may be stranded due to the escalating violence across the border. She extended support to Bangladeshis who visited West Bengal but encountered difficulties in returning home.Banerjee appealed to the people of West Bengal to exercise restraint and not be provoked by matters concerning the current situation in Bangladesh, saying, "We should exercise restraint and not walk into any provocation or excitement on the issue."She also expressed solidarity with those affected by the ongoing violence and the students who lost their lives.BJP in response, strongly criticized Mamata Banerjee for her statement offering refuge to individuals fleeing hardship in Bangladesh. The party labeled the move as a nefarious scheme orchestrated by the INDIA alliance, alleging that their intention is to relocate unauthorized migrants from Bangladesh to Jharkhand in order to sway election outcomes.Amit Malviya, the BJP co-incharge for West Bengal, raised doubts about Banerjee's jurisdiction in extending shelter to foreign nationals. He highlighted that matters concerning immigration and citizenship fall strictly under the purview of the central government, asserting that "immigration and citizenship are exclusively in the Centre's domain, and that states have no locus-standi in such matters."The widespread clashes across Bangladesh have claimed the lives of more than 150 people. The unrest, stemming from discontent over the allocation of government jobs, has led the government to impose a strict curfew with "shoot-on-sight" orders nationwide.The Supreme Court of Bangladesh on Sunday scaled back the controversial quota system for civil service job applicants, reducing its scope but stopping short of complete abolition. This decision follows the system's reinstatement last month, which sparked the deadly civil unrest across the country.
Article Summary: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee offered to provide shelter to those in distress amid the ongoing violence in Bangladesh. She cited the United Nations Resolution on refugees as justification for her stance, considering the severe law and order breakdown that has gripped Bangladesh in recent days. The widespread clashes across Bangladesh have claimed the lives of more than 150 people.

Article Title: 'Next time Congress should ... ': BJP on Jairam Ramesh's 'live-tweets' from all-party meeting
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) on Sunday attacked Congress leader Jairam Ramesh for " live-tweeting " various issues raised by different political parties during an all-party meeting and made strong remark against the opposition party stating that they should consider sending a "more seasoned hand" next time.During the meeting the congress leaser, who was in attendance in a post on the social media platform X wrote: "In today's all-party meeting of floor leaders chaired by defence minister Rajnath Singh, the JD(U) leader demanded special category status for Bihar.The YSRCP leader demanded special category status for Andhra Pradesh. Strangely, the TDP leader kept quiet on the matter."BJP's IT department head Amit Malviya said: "There is a certain propriety and protocol one associates with these all party meetings.""There is free and frank exchange of ideas followed by media briefing. But a look at Jairam Ramesh's timeline and it appears he was live tweeting the proceedings. Next time, the Congress should consider sending a more seasoned hand for these meetings," Malviya added.Ramesh's social media posts contained a political angle as he underscored the demands put forth by two regional parties, which poses a challenging situation for the central government.Officials have argued that the Finance Commission's recommendations, which have been accepted by the government that prevent such a possibility.The Congress leader also took a swipe at the TDP which is another ally of the BJP.
Article Summary: The Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) on Sunday attacked Congress leader Jairam Ramesh for " live-tweeting " various issues raised by different political parties during an all-party meeting. The BJP made strong remark against the opposition party stating that they should consider sending a "more seasoned hand" next time.

Article Title: Two women partially buried in gravel during protest in Madhya Pradesh
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Two women in Madhya Pradesh 's Rewa district were half buried when a truck dumped gravel on them while they were protesting against road construction .The video of the incident doing rounds on social media platforms showed the women sitting behind the dumpster just before being half buried in gravel.According to the police officials, the incident occurred in Hinota Jorot village under Mangawa police station on Saturday and a case has been registered.Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Vivek Lal said the women, Mamta Pandey and Asha Pandey, were protesting against the road construction and got partially buried under murrum."The police are investigating the matter, and action will be taken based on evidence," he said.Meanwhile, MP congress chief Jeetendra Patwari claimed that this incident in Rewa district has once again raised serious questions about the safety of women in the state.Taking to X, Patwari said, "This incident in Rewa district has once again raised serious questions on the safety of women under the Bharatiya Janata Party's regime! Anyway, Madhya Pradesh ranks first in atrocities against women!""Mohan Yadav ji, these sisters of Rewa's Mangawan were buried in gravel and an attempt was made to kill them! Can these sisters expect from your government that this incident will be investigated impartially and quickly and they will get justice on priority? Well, your government is repeatedly failing to stop crimes against women!" he added.
Article Summary: Two women in Madhya Pradesh were half buried when a truck dumped gravel on them while they were protesting against road construction. MP congress chief Jeetendra Patwari claimed that this incident in Rewa district has once again raised serious questions about the safety of women in the state.

Article Title: Jairam posts 'live' from all-party meet, draws BJP, JDU ire
Article Text: NEW DELHI: BJP and its key ally JDU on Sunday hit out at Congress' Jairam Ramesh for what they perceive as "inappropriate conduct" at a pre-budget all-party meeting, during which he "posted on X live updates of the proceedings".Parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju endorsed concern expressed by the alliance party, saying, "This is unfortunate. Everyone must maintain the sanctity and protocol of Parliamentary traditions." BJP's IT cell head Amit Malviya said while open discussion is encouraged, media briefings usually follow the meetings.He pointed out that Ramesh's social media activity during the meeting appeared to be "live-tweeting", which he deemed contrary to the expected protocol."There is a certain propriety and protocol one associates with these all party meetings. There is free and frank exchange of ideas followed by media briefing . But a look at Jairam Ramesh's timeline and it appears he was live tweeting the proceedings. Next time, the Congress should consider sending a more seasoned hand for these meetings," Malviya wrote on X.Jairam had posted: "In today's all-party meeting... JDU demanded special category status of Bihar. YSRCP demanded special category status for Andhra. Strangely, TDP kept quiet on the matter."Responding to it, JDU working president Sanjay Jha posted: "...I wish the senior Congress member respected the sanctity of the Parliamentary proceedings ."
Article Summary: BJP and its key ally JDU hit out at Congress' Jairam Ramesh for what they perceive as "inappropriate conduct" at a pre-budget all-party meeting. He "posted on X live updates of the proceedings", which they deemed contrary to expected protocol.

Article Title: Stay UP's name display order: TMC's Moitra in SC
Article Text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has moved SC against the directives by UP and Uttarakhand govts that eateries along the Kanwar Yatra route must display the names of their owners. In her plea, Moitra has sought a stay on the orders passed by the two state govts saying such directives aggravate discord between communities. The plea is yet to be listed for hearing.Moitra said by forcing the disclosure of the names of proprietors and even those of their staff, on the stated ground of respecting pilgrims' dietary choices, "makes it clear that dietary choices is a pretext, or a proxy, for the compelled disclosure of personal - and, in this case, religious - identity", the plea said.The plea alleged that this has been done to create a socially-enforced economic boycott on Muslim shop owners and workers, and the loss of their livelihoods.On Monday, SC is scheduled to hear a plea against UP govt's controversial order . A bench of justices Hrishikesh Roy and S V N Bhatti is likely to hear plea filed by NGO Association of Protection of Civil Rights.
Article Summary: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has moved SC against the directives by UP and Uttarakhand govts that eateries along the Kanwar Yatra route must display the names of their owners. The plea alleged that this has been done to create a socially-enforced economic boycott on Muslim shop owners.

Article Title: NDA govt's days are numbered: Mamata, Akhilesh at mega TMC rally
Article Text: KOLKATA: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav patted each other's back on Sunday in front of a mammoth crowd at Trinamool Congress ' annual martyrs' day rally for "showing BJP its place" in their respective states, saying it was now clear that NDA 3.0 govt's days are numbered."BJP should have resigned after what you (Akhilesh) did in UP (in Lok Sabha polls).However, they don't have any shame left and you have to wait a while," Mamata said. "I am thankful to people of UP for making you the second largest opposition (after Congress) in Parliament. NDA has already stayed in govt for a long time. Enough is enough." She said nobody would be able to uproot the party as long they were content "being poor, eating bhaat-roti, and making do with whatever you have at home".As Akhilesh looked on, Mamata said she didn't need "rich party workers going around in cars" but "conscientious ones" who would uphold the virtues of introspection, humility and service to society. "The more we win, the humbler we must become," said Mamata."Remember, Trinamool Congress is not just a political platform, but a stage to serve people," she said.Akhilesh, who drove to Mamata's home in south Kolkata's Kalighat straight from the airport, had a meeting with her for around half an hour to discuss "fault lines" in NDA "despite their attempt to project a picture of unity", sources said.At the rally, he declared, "They (BJP) don't have anyone who can dedicate his life for a cause. How can those who divide humanity produce great leaders?"
Article Summary: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav patted each other's back on Sunday in front of a mammoth crowd at Trinamool Congress'annual martyrs' day rally. She said it was now clear that NDA 3.0 govt's days are numbered.

Article Title: 'Finding it difficult to digest defeat,' says Bansuri Swaraj after Somnath Bharti challenges her in high court
Article Text:
What is the petition about?

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj on Sunday responded to the allegations made by AAP leader Somnath Bharti , who challenged her victory in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, claiming that Swaraj engaged in alleged corrupt practices during the electoral process.Bansuri Swaraj said, "Somnath Bharti is finding it difficult to digest his defeat. He has lost the Lok Sabha elections and not just the Lok Sabha but also in the Malviya Nagar assembly constituency from where he has been MLA for so long.So he is finding it difficult to digest his defeat. A question is also getting raised over his political survival. So to justify his defeat he has filed this petition against me.""I will stand firm against the lies of MLA Somnath Bharti and the lies of AAP," Swaraj told to ANI on Sunday.Somnath Bharti on Saturday filed a petition in the Delhi high court, challenging the victory of BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj in the Lok Sabha elections 2024, alleging corrupt practices.The matter is scheduled to be heard by Justice Manmeet Pritam Arora on July 22, 2024.Somnath Bharti has approached the court, requesting the concerned Returning Officer to provide records related to the elections held in the 04-New Delhi parliamentary constituency on May 25, 2024. The matter is set to be heard by Justice Manmeet Pritam Arora's bench on July 22, 2024."The present petition is being filed by the petitioner (Bharti) under Section 80 and 81 of the Representation of the People Act challenging the election of the respondent no.1 (Swaraj) as a Member of House of the people from the New Delhi parliamentary constituency on the grounds of 'corrupt practices' indulged into by the respondent no.1 , her election agent and other persons with the consent of the respondent during the course of Lok Sabha election 2024 held on May 25, 2024," the plea said.According to the returning officer, Swaraj secured 4,53,185 votes, while Bharti obtained 3,74,815 votes. The plea alleges that Swaraj, her election agent, and other individuals engaged in "corrupt practices" with her consent during the course of the election.Bharti's plea further claims that former AAP minister Raaj Kumar Anand, who contested the election on a BSP ticket, was actually set up by Swaraj's party to assist her against the petitioner.Raaj Kumar Anand submitted his nomination papers on May 6, 2024, as a candidate for the New Delhi Parliamentary Constituency, representing the Bahujan Samaj Party, according to the plea.BSP had fielded Anand as part of their nationwide strategy to support Bansuri Swaraj's victory by dividing the votes of the INDIA Alliance candidate. "He secured 5629 votes, as per the Returning Officer."Anand officially joined the BJP, Bansuri Swaraj's party, on July 10, 2024.
Article Summary: Somnath Bharti on Saturday filed a petition in the Delhi high court, challenging the victory of BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj in the Lok Sabha elections 2024, alleging corrupt practices. The matter is set to be heard by Justice Manmeet Pritam Arora's bench on July 22, 2024.

Article Title: Kedarnath: Khapa resident among three killed in Kedarnath landslide
Article Text: NAGPUR: A 32-year-old man, Kishore Parate , resident of Dongeghat in Khapa in Nagpur district, was among the three killed in landslide near Gaurikund enroute to Kedarnath pilgrimage on Sunday morning. Another nine were rendered injured, including three serious, in the incident.During monsoon, landslides are common in the mountains. Apart from slippery treks, the pilgrims are often left to counter heavy rains and also landslides.Parate was among the two from Maharashtra to have got killed in the incident.The other person was 24-year-old Sunil Kale from Jalna. Parate and his two other friends had left for Kedarnath from Nagpur on July 15.Sources stated the landslide had taken place near Chirvasa around three km away from Gaurikund when the pilgrims had started trekking towards the Kedarnath shrine.The victims were trapped under the descending rocks and boulders. While few could jump to safety, a group came under the falling rocks and boulders.According to Uttarakhand police, the Gaurikund police and the local rescue teams had rushed to the place. The injured were sent to the Gaurikund primary health centre for medical assistance. The bodies were also being shifted to Rudraprayag from where they would be despatched to Delhi for flight.
Article Summary: A 32-year-old man, Kishore Parate, resident of Dongeghat in Khapa in Nagpur district, was among the three killed in landslide near Gaurikund. Another nine were rendered injured, including three serious, in the incident. Parate and his two other friends had left from Nagpur on July 15.

Article Title: Oppn has exposed failures of govt in assembly: Cong
Article Text:
Panaji

Amit Patkar

: The ongoing assembly session has exposed the govt’s shortcomings and failures, said Congress. The state Congress presidentsaid that all the ministers in the cabinet are involved in corruption and this has been shown by the opposition in the assembly.“This govt is out to destroy the common man and is only looking out for their crony friends,” said Patkar.Patkar said that the Goa Electricity Department (GED) has Rs 2,214 crore outstanding dues from commercial users, industrial users and govt departments, which should be recovered instead of increasing the power tariff for domestic consumers.“The net gap of surplus for the electricity department is Rs 415 crore which is why the govt told the JERC that it has to increase the power tariff,” said Patkar.Patkar also said that Congress has managed to expose the govt’s failures in the tourism , transport, and health sectors and BJP’s interest in the ST community.“The first two days of the assembly session have shown what concern the BJP has for the ST community. It is the first time in the history of Goa that the ruling party created a ruckus in the House and disrupted the question hour. They wanted to defer the main questions that address the issues of Goa such as Dabolim airport, NEP and others,” said Patkar.Congress said that the Mopa six-lane elevated link road should have been part of the Manohar International Airport instead of floating a separate contract and charging a toll for its usage. “Govt should take back the decision to charge toll from people,” he said.
Article Summary: The state Congress presidentsaid that all the ministers in the cabinet are involved in corruption. “This govt is out to destroy the common man and is only looking out for their crony friends,” said Patkar. Patkar said that the Goa Electricity Department (GED) has Rs 2,214 crore outstanding dues.

Article Title: Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli secures two-third majority in parliament
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli on Sunday managed to secure a two-thirds majority in the vote of confidence motion tabled in parliament. Oli received 188 votes in the 275-member parliament, with 74 votes in opposition and one abstinent, the house speaker announced.Oli required 138 out of a total of 275 votes to pass the floor test in the House of Representatives (HoR)."The number of honourable members of parliament present in today's vote division stands at 263. Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli, as per Article 76 (4) of the Constitution , presented the trust motion in the House of Representatives, the votes in favour stand at 188 votes, against the motion 74 and one abstinent," house speaker Devraj Ghimire announced."The trust motion proposed by Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli as per the Constitution of Nepal, Article 76(4), claims the confidence of the House of Representatives, which has 188 votes in support and that number is the majority on the basis of the number of members present in the meeting. I hereby announce that the proposal of trust motion filed by Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli has been endorsed with majority," the house speaker added.The veteran Communist leader was sworn in on Monday as the Himalayan nation's prime minister for the fourth time. He was administered the oath of office and secrecy along with 21 other members of the Cabinet.According to Nepal's Constitution, Oli needed to secure a vote of confidence from Parliament within 30 days of appointment.Oli was appointed as prime minister on Sunday by President Ram Chandra Paudel to lead the coalition government with the Nepali Congress (NC), the largest party in Parliament, apart from other smaller parties.Oli succeeded Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda', who lost the vote of confidence in the House of Representatives on July 12.
Article Summary: Oli received 188 votes in the 275-member parliament, with 74 votes in opposition and one abstinent. Oli required 138 out of a total of 275 votes to pass the floor test. The veteran Communist leader was sworn in on Monday as the Himalayan nation's prime minister.
